result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Bollerud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: May serve in DANE Co. if accepted.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety.  Random UAs. No contact w/R.M., J.P., T.W. (victims) or M.B. or T.C. (co-actors).

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J Bollerud

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew J Bollerud in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  State moves to amend Ct 1 to 943.10(1m)(a) as a PTAC then states recs.  Atty Benavides agrees and requests 30 days for DE to report to jail.  Court grants motion to amend Ct 1 to felony burglary as PTAC.  Atty Benavides enters NC plea.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  State notes victims were noticed of today's hearing and VIS filed for the Court and DE to review.  State makes statement re: recommendation.  Atty Benavides makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  

Ct 1:  NC - as amended - 943.10(1m)(a)
Probation for 3 years
Conditions of probation:
$268.00 costs and $10.00 property crime surcharge and $250.00 DNA surcharges to be paid per agent during term of probation
$2813.59 restitution plus surcharges to be paid joint and several w/co-actors (M.B. and T.C.) 
DNA sample to be provided
30 days jail as condition of probation w/huber privileges 
To commence on or before 9/11/2015 at 6:30 pm
May be serve in Dane Co if accepted 
No contact w/R.M., J.P., or T.W. (victims of crime) or co-actors (M.B. or T.C.)
AODA/Treatment per agent
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances at all times unless he has a valid prescription
Random urinalysis per agent
Not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business that sells drug paraphernalia
Treatment/assessment for criminal thinking and any other counseling per agent
Obtain/maintain full-time employment/education per agent
Cash bond to be applied to the restitution
3 days sentence credit to be applied if probation is revoked
DE to report to P&P yet this afternoon
Final pre-trial on May 26, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew J Bollerud in court with attorney Dennis Joseph Ryan.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.    Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial Br. 1.  Bond continues.

Defendant Andrew J Bollerud in court with attorney Dennis Joseph Ryan.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Ryan states DE will waive prelim today.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Return date on July 29, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew J Bollerud in court with attorney Dennis J Ryan.  Sue Mueller Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan request another PTC.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew J Bollerud by video from LEC with attorney Thomas L Steinman.  Defendant Andrew J Bollerud in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests Court amend charging paragraph date from 5/12/2013 to 5/12/2014.  Court so amends.

Pre-trial conference on June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Return date on June 20, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew J Bollerud appeared by video means with Attorney Steinman. Prosecuting Atty Sue M Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not yet qualifed for public defender.  State request cash bond with conditions.  Attorney Steinman advises defendant is 19 years of age.  Address is correct.  Local ties to area.  Defendant is not currently employed.  No criminal history.  Attorney Steinman request signature bond.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.   Time limits waived. $500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with R.M., J.P., T.W., 1103 Connie Road, West Baraboo, and co actors-T.C., M.B.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
